content: Shifting to Slide 11 to discuss our outlook for the second quarter, we expect revenue between $55 million and $57 million, again, with the largest year over decline in subscription revenue adjusted EBITDA between $4 million and $6 million, reflecting the timing of expenses shifting from Q1 to Q2 and non-GAAP net loss available to common stockholders between $6 million and $4 million, which represents a non-GAAP net loss per share of between $0.17 and $0.11 based on 34 million basic shares outstanding.
